intro: Zephyranthes reginae, commonly known as the Queen of the Windflower, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and red. The plant typically grows from a bulb and produces its flowers in late summer or early autumn. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Zephyranthes reginae is also known for its ability to thrive in coastal areas due to its tolerance for salt spray.
